paper_abstract: Konig's infinity lemma states that an infinite rooted tree in which every node has finite degree has an infinite path. A variation of this lemma about mappings from one tree to another is presented in this note. Its proof utilizes Konig's lemma, and Konig's lemma follows from this variation. (C) 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Mapping among the nodes of infinite trees: A variation of Konig's infinity lemma
